item.title: Stackoverflow: User inputs for Rmarkdown without shiny
item.description: This was the title of a stackOverflow questinon that I answered. The user needed interactivity without shiny as dependency. This is something that can be done but you need to know a little of JavaScript or use a very specific package like {crosstalk}. I do not think there is another way to get it done. With that in mind I gave him an option, maybe not exactly what he was looking for, but a useful one.

item.title: Reacciones en documentos Rmarkdown con JavaScript
item.description: .buttons { display: flex; width: 280px; justify-content: space-around; margin: 0 auto; } .btn { border: solid 2px; padding: 10px; border-radius: 10px; color: white; width: 100px; text-align: center; background-color: #F85B1A; transition: transform 250ms ease-in-out, opasity 250ms linear; } .btn:hover, .btn:focus { background-color: #072083; transform: scale(1.1); opacity: .9; cursor: pointer; color: white; } .character-img { display: block; margin: 0 auto; height: 400px; } Mi primer contacto con documentos HTML fue mediante Rmarkdown en Rstudio.
